thread.title: ‘Minions’ poised for weekend of dominating domestic box offices
thread.title_full: ‘Minions’ poised for weekend of dominating domestic box offices

title: ‘Minions’ poised for weekend of dominating domestic box offices
text:
Published: July 9, 2015 2:17 p.m. ET Share The Minions are coming to take over the weekend box office. 
By Trey Williams Reporter 
All the Minions have ever wanted to do, presumably, is help take over the world. While the world is a bit audacious, when “Minions” opens this weekend it will help continue Universal Studios’s box office domination. 
“Minions,” a prequel based on the adored characters from 2010’s “Despicable Me,” has garnered talk of possibly passing the opening-weekend box office revenue of “Toy Story 3,” according to Wunderlich Securities analyst Matthew Harrigan. He said it’s opening weekend should fall within the $100 million to $110 million vicinity. “Toy Story 3” ranks as the second highest opening weekend for an animated movie with $110.3 million, according to boxofficemojo.com. 
Universal Studios, owned by Comcast Corp. CMCSA, +0.52% has had an extraordinary and record breaking year so far. “Jurassic World” had the largest movie opening ever at $208.8 million, and has grossed $556 million domestically. Universal’s $1.3 billion in box office revenue leads all other studios and has been helped, in large part, by the gross revenues of “Furious 7” ($351 million), “Pitch Perfect 2” ($182 million) and “50 Shades of Grey” ($116 million). 
Also read: Universal Studios has a grip on domestic box offices so far this year 
“And it has ‘Minions’ right on deck and it’s already doing very well overseas,” said Rentrak Corp. RENT, +1.60% analyst Paul Dergarabedian earlier this week. Boxofficemojo.com reports that “Minons” has grossed $141.7 million in foreign markets already. “They’re like the marshmallows in a box of Lucky Charms, everybody wants them and they can’t get enough.” More from MarketWatch
